columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to assess rights.

Let us first identify the given amounts in the problem: 


| | Amount$\hspace{5pt}$| 
|:--|--:| 
|Ex-right price| $63.00|
|Current share price |$68.00| 
|Shares outstanding  |26 million|
|Rights offer | $70 million|

The only data the problem provided us are the ex-right price, current share price, number of shares outstanding, and the rights offer. Thus, we will use ex-right price computation in order for us to determine the subscription price. The ex-right price is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Ex-rights price}&=\dfrac{\text{(RN $\times$ SP) + S}}{\text{1 + RN }}\\
\end{aligned}$$ 

Where: 

RN = Rights needed 

SP = Share price 

S = Subscription price

First, let us compute the number of ex-right shares since it is needed to compute the ex-right share price. This is computed by dividing the shares outstanding by the number of new shares. This is computed as follows: 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Number of ex-rights shares }&=\dfrac{\text{SO}}{\text{R  $\div$ S}}\\
\end{aligned}$$ 

Where: 

SO = Shares outstanding 

R = Rights offer 

S = Subscription price

Now, we will use the formula from step 3 to compute the subscription price. We will insert the data provided in this exercise. The subscription price is computed as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{\$63.00}&=\dfrac{\text{(0.3714S $\times$ \$68.00) + S}}{\text{1 + 0.3714S }}\\[10pt]
\text{\$63.00}&=\dfrac{\text{25.2552S + S}}{\text{1 + 0.3714S }}\\[10pt]
\text{\$63.00 + 23.3982S }&={\text{26.2552S}}\\[10pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Then, let us rearrange the formula by shifting S to another side. This is done as follows: 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{ 26.2552S - 23.3982S }&={\text{\$63.00}}\\
\text{ 2.857S }&={\text{\$63.00}}\\
\end{aligned}$$
**To conclude, the subscription price amounts to $22.05.**
